page.title: 15NATURE,TATTON PARK KNUTSFORD
page.content: Tatton Park is very old with early settlements dating back to Saxon times. In 1290 permission was given to fence off Tatton Park so the owner could keep deer. Today the 2,000 acres of Parkland still contain 293 red deer and 556 fallow deer. There are also flocks of soya sheep, which are browny gold in colour and come from an island in Scotland. Tatton Park has many trees including oak, beech, lime, horse- and sweet- chestnut, Scots pine, sycamore, elm, larch and hawthorn. Also there is almost every native animal you could imagine except badgers. The Park has 2 meres, Melchett and Tatton. They contain pike, bream, perch, carp, tench, roach and rudd.
